snippet: The murder of the British businessman, Neil Heywood, is still seen as stemming from a financial dispute, but the intelligence links add an enticing subplot to his death.
abstract: Wall Street Journal reports that British businessman Neil Heywood, murdered in 2011 by Gu Kailai, the wife of a Chinese Politburo member, regularly met with an operative of MI6, the British intelligence agency; report says Heywood was an unpaid informant who provided information on the family of Bo Xilai; murder is still seen as stemming from financial dispute but intelligence links add an enticing subplot to Heywood's death.

byline.original: By JONATHAN ANSFIELD and IAN JOHNSON
byline.contributor: Mia Li contributed research. Ravi Somaiya contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: The murder of the British businessman, Neil Heywood, is still seen as stemming from a financial dispute, but the intelligence links add an enticing subplot to his death.

headline.seo: China Said to Suspect Neil Heywood Was a Spy
headline.main: China’s Security Ministry Suspected Slain Businessman Was a Spy
headline.print_headline: China Said to Suspect That Slain Briton Was a Spy
